examples.text: The new law makes it a criminal offense to drink alcohol in public places.
She pleaded guilty to five traffic offenses.

definitions.definition: the feeling of being upset or angry at something that somebody has said or done

examples.text: The photo may **cause offense** to some people.
No one will **take offense** *(= feel upset or insulted)* if you leave early.
Don't be so quick to **take offense**.
Many readers **took offense at** the article.
I'm sure he **meant no offense** when he said that.
I didn't mean to give offense to anyone.

definitions.definition: the members of a team whose main aim is to score points against the other team; a method of attack

examples.text: The team's offense is stronger than their defense.
He played offense for the Chicago Bulls.

definitions.definition: used to say that you do not mean to upset or show a lack of respect for somebody by something you say or do

examples.text: No offense, but I'd really like to be by myself.
No offense intended, but are you sure your calculations are right?
